meanings.definition: The practice of preparing, stuffing, and mounting the skins of animals for display.
meanings.sent1: The taxidermies in the museum showcase various animals in lifelike poses.
meanings.sent2: The taxidermies of the deer and bear looked so real in the wildlife exhibit.
meanings.sent3: The taxidermies of the squirrel and raccoon seemed to have a conversation in the corner.
meanings.sent4: The taxidermies on the walls of the cabin brought the room to life.
meanings.sent5: The taxidermies of the birds were so detailed, they almost seemed to chirp.

meanings.definition: The art or process of preserving the skin of an animal with its natural appearance.
meanings.sent1: The taxidermies of the fox and owl were beautifully done, capturing their natural beauty.
meanings.sent2: The taxidermies of the lion and zebra were displayed in the natural history museum.
meanings.sent3: The taxidermies of the animals looked like they were frozen in time, forever preserved.
meanings.sent4: The taxidermies of the pets in the shop window caught the attention of passersby.
meanings.sent5: The taxidermies of the animals were so well-preserved, they appeared almost alive.
